Elementary school parents/students! Great news! NKES' and GWES' Library is going curbside!! The library will begin checking out books next week.

Here's how it will work: Browse through the library collection online to find a book you would like. Open the Google Form and fill it out by 11 am Friday. Submit the form.

Monday mornings from 9-12 we will have curbside pick up for your requests. Books will be delivered to your car out in front of the school. We will also be accepting library books for return. These will be stored for two weeks for everyone's safety before being available for circulation.

The Google Form also allows you to request books by subject, author, or reading level, so you don't have to have a specific title to request. A Google Form must be filled out in order to pick up books. You will get an email response if any books requested are not available that week. Below are the two links to the schools' Google Forms:

GWES - https://bit.ly/GWLibraryBookRequest

New Kent County Public Schools (NKCPS) takes student health seriously. We understand that there is some parental concern regarding student exposure to a variety of illnesses. We are monitoring our student and staff attendance numbers daily and talking with nurses about confirmed cases of the flu.

In addition to standard daily cleaning, our cleaning service provider, has begun specialized cleaning within our school district. These daily cleaning efforts include wiping down desks, water fountains, doorknobs, and light switches with a specialized cleaning solution. These extra daily cleaning efforts must be combined with parental support in following recommended guidelines to reduce illness.

NKCPS recommends that if your child is showing signs of illness, that you seek medical care and not send your child to school. Please keep your child‚Äôs school informed of your child‚Äôs progress. Thank you for helping us maintain a healthy learning environment for all of our students.

In accordance with NKCPS School Board policy, the following criteria will be utilized for naming the school.

The naming suggestions must be received in writing with justification for why the name is to be considered. The school board may consider the names of deceased individuals, who passed away at least 10 years prior and during their lifetime made a significant contribution to the New Kent School Division and/or community. The school board will not consider the names of any living individuals. The school board may also consider geographical names. The full text of the regulation may be reviewed at http://bit.ly/NKFFA2019

post_text: The NKCPS School Board wants to let you know they have selected Dr.Carol Fenn to serve as our Acting Superintendent for the months of May and June. She began her career teaching fifth and first graders and reading before moving on to principal at the elementary and middle school level. She has held several division wide roles including Director of Instruction and Assistant Superintendent of Personnel. Dr. Fenn has an extensive list of accomplishments as a leader and educator. Most importantly Dr. Fenn is a hands on leader who likes to be out in the buildings and at extra curricular school events. She makes it a point to meet students, teachers, principals, and members of the community.

post_text: We drove many of the roads throughout New Kent late this afternoon, including areas that are known to be the slowest to melt. New Kent County Public Schools will operate on a two hour delay tomorrow, Tuesday, January 9th. We are going to be on the roads early in the morning to make sure there has not been any refreezing. We would only call if there is a change to the 2 hour delay. Again we are on a 2 hour delay unless you receive another call in the morning. On a final note, we provide a bus for all students. We would ask parents of student drivers to assess whether they want their child to ride the bus or drive themselves. We appreciate your patience and support as we have worked through this storm and extremely cold weather.

At New Kent High School on April 26, 2017 at 6:00 pm, there is going to be a community forum titled Drugs in Our Community- What You Should Know- What We Can Do forum.

Drug abuse is an increasing national and local problem that affects all of us. New Kent County government and schools are striving to bring as many people together as we can to engage in a conversation around drug use in our community. We will have several panel speakers and a question and answer session. There will also be several agency and service providers there for people to speak to after the event concludes. We know it is a busy time of year, but hope you will carve out some time this evening to engage with us in addressing this important issue in our community.

Kindergarten Registration is taking place at NKES and GWES on April 10, 2014 from 9:30am - 11:00am! You may download the registration packet from the district website.

Please bring the following items with you to registration:
1. Birth Certificate, naturalization certificate, or visa.
2. Social security number (where applicable).
3. Immunization records and physical (must comply with current Virginia Department of Health guidelines).
4. If you are a separated or divorced parent, you must provide proof of custody at the time of registration.
5. An acceptable proof of residency (eg: a copy of a voter registration card, utility bill, rental agreement, or a copy of a contract for the purchase of a home).
6. Also, Please bring your child so they can meet with the Kindergarten teachers.

We look forward to seeing all of our upcoming Kindergartners and their parents on Thursday!
